intro: Micranthes nudicaulis, commonly known as the slender meadow beauty, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in a fine layer of fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in prairies and open woodlands.
